Dear Sven,
 
There may be but I am not aware of it. You need some criteria =
such as an adiababtic flame temperature or an unrealistically low laminar f=
lame velocity. I am curious to see if someone does have a method. My sugges=
tion comes from www.safekinex.org - an EC funded project on explosion safet=
y in the chemical industry.
 
Regards,
 
MB

______________________________=
__

From: cantera@yahoogroups.com on behalf of Sven Jerzembeck
Sent: Wed 07=
/02/2007 22:40
To: cantera@yahoogroups.com
Subject: RE: [cantera] claclulat=
e flammability limite of a premixed mixture



Hi martin,
thanks for the an=
swer. I will check the publication.
but one little question more; is there =
no cance to calculate with cantera, lets say for a homogenious reactor if a=
 mixture will ignite or not if the activation energy is large enough?
 
reg=
ards
 
sven

"Braithwaite, Martin" <m.braithwaite@...> schrieb:
=

	There is perhaps no substitute for measurement, particularly for the UFL.=
 You could try an approximate empirical approach from this source - 
	
	1. =
Kondo S., Urano Y., Tokuhashi K., Takahashi A., Tanaka K., Prediction of fl=
ammability of gases by using F-number analysis, Journal of Hazardous Materi=
als, A82 (2001) 113-128.
	
	Regards,
	
	Martin Braithwaite
	
	Imperial Coll=
ege
